citation.article-title: Phenotypic and phylogenetic characterization of some unknown coryneform bacteria isolated from bovine blood and milk: description of Sanguibacter gen.nov.

p.s: Sanguibacter keddieii (ked.diéi.i. M.L. gen.n. keddieii, named in honour of R.M. Keddie, a British bacterlologlst)
Cells consist of Gram-positive, short, irregular shaped motile rods.
Colonies are circular, convex, with entire edges and yellow in colour.
Colonies range from 1.0 to 2.0 mm in diameter after 48 h of incubation on TSA.
Strains are Voges-Proskauer negative and do not reduce nitrate.
Cellulose and Tween 80 are not hydrolysed.

Acid is produced from α-methyl-D-mannoside, α-methyl-D-glucoside, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, rhamnose, wrafinose, glycerol, L-arabinose, ribose, D-xylose, β-methyl-xyloside, galactose, glucose, fructose, D-mannose, rhamnose, arbutin, sorbitol, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, lactose, melibiose, sucrose, trehalose, raffinose, glycogen, β-gentibiose, turanose and lyxose.
Some strains produce acid from gluconate.
Acid is not produced from mannitol, inulin, D-arabinose, erythritol, 5-cetogluconate, xylose, adonitol, L-sorbose, inositol, melezitose, xylitol, tagatose, fucose and arabitol.
The G + C content of DNA of the type strain is 70 mol%.
